member.summary: Defines how an animation channel behaves outside the defined time range.

member.summary: The value from the default node transformation is taken.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.Animations.AnimationBehaviour.Constant
member.summary: The nearest key value is used without interpolation.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.Animations.AnimationBehaviour.Linear
member.summary: The value of the nearest two keys is linearly extrapolated for the current time value.

member.name: F:Ez.Graphics.Data.Animations.AnimationBehaviour.Repeat
member.summary: The animation is repeated. If the animation key go from n to m and the current time is t, use the value at (t-n) % (|m-n|).

member.name: T:Ez.Graphics.Data.Animations.AnimationNode
member.summary:
Describes the animation of a single node.
The name specifies the bone/node which is affected by this animation channel. The keyframes are given in three separate series of values, one each for position, rotation and scaling. The transformation matrix computed from these values replaces the node's original transformation matrix at a specific time. This means all keys are absolute and not relative to the bone default pose.
The order in which the transformations are applied is as usual - scaling, rotation, translation.
Note: All keys are returned in their correct, chronological order. Duplicate keys don't pass the validation step. Most likely there will be no negative time values, but they are not forbidden also ( so implementations need to cope with them! )
Initializes a new instance of class.
member.param: The name of the animation node.
The behaviour of the animation before the first key is encountered.
The behaviour of the animation after the last key was processed.

member.summary: Clone constructor.

member.name: P:Ez.Graphics.Data.Animations.AnimationNode.Name
member.summary: The name of the node affected by this animation. The node must exist and it must be unique.

member.name: P:Ez.Graphics.Data.Animations.AnimationNode.PostState
member.summary: Defines how the animation behaves after the last key was processed. The default value is (the original transformation matrix of the affected node is taken).

member.name: P:Ez.Graphics.Data.Animations.AnimationNode.PreState
member.summary: Defines how the animation behaves before the first key is encountered. The default value is (the original transformation matrix of the affected node is used).

member.name: P:Ez.Graphics.Data.Animations.AnimationNode.PositionKeys
member.summary: The position keys of this animation channel. Positions are specified as 3D vector.The array is mNumPositionKeys in size. If there are position keys, there will also be at least one scaling and one rotation key.

member.name: P:Ez.Graphics.Data.Animations.AnimationNode.RotationKeys
member.summary: The rotation keys of this animation channel. Rotations are given as quaternions, which are 4D vectors.The array is mNumRotationKeys in size. If there are rotation keys, there will also be at least one scaling and one position key.

member.name: P:Ez.Graphics.Data.Animations.AnimationNode.ScalingKeys
member.summary: The scaling keys of this animation channel. Scalings are specified as 3D vector.The array is mNumScalingKeys in size. If there are scaling keys, there will also be at least one position and one rotation key.
